newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran complains U.S. forces violated its territory.
newsitem.headline: Iran complains U.S. forces violated its territory.

text.p: Iran has complained to the United Nations over alleged violations of its territory by U.S. forces stationed in the Gulf, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Saturday.

In a letter to U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan on Friday, Iranian deputy U.N. envoy Majid Takhtravanchi said U.S. warships and helicopters "repeatedly created a nuisance for Iranian ships and vessels", the agency said.
The letter cited several alleged incidents including one on January 8 in which two U.S. helicopters flew over an Iranian cargo ship travelling in Iranian waters and ordered it to change course.
Washington has in the past denied similar Iranian accusations.
The United States, which has vowed to protect its Gulf Arab allies from any potential security threats from Iran and Iraq, has a strong naval and air presence in the Gulf.
Iran has repeatedly condemned the U.S. military presence in the region, where U.S.-led forces enforce U.N. sanctions against Iraq.
